thread.title_full: Volvo Throws Down the Gauntlet to Luxury Rivals - WSJ

author: William Boston
title: Volvo Throws Down the Gauntlet to Luxury Rivals - WSJ
text:
Volvo Throws Down the Gauntlet to Luxury Rivals Swedish auto makerâ€™s CEO says demand is so high that tight supply could limit sales Por BerlinDiary Feb. 8, 2017 5:45 a.m. ET 
Volvo Car Group forecast record sales in 2017 after profit surged last year on strong demand in the U.S. and China, as the Chinese-owned auto maker tries to harness its Swedish genes to chip away at German domination of the global premium car market. 
Since it was taken over by Zhejiang Geely Holding Group for $1.8 billion in 2010, Volvo has spruced up its model lineup to boost demand, which has led to sharply higher sales in the U.S. and China. Volvo has slashed costs in part by manufacturing some models in China for... To Read the Full Story, Suscribirse o Sign In Most Popular Videos
